newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX ACCESS crude rises on likely short covering.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX ACCESS crude rises on likely short covering.

text.p: NYMEX ACCESS crude oil prices rose overnight Tuesday, lifted by short covering ahead of Thursday's expiry of the April contract, brokers reckoned.
NYMEX April crude traded $22.33 a barrel, up 27 cents from the settle as 1,263 lots traded in the front-month, traders said. A total of 3,200 lots traded.
But crude's overnight rise was curbed after traders discounted a bullish-looking inventory report late Tuesday.
A meager increase in crude last week was discounted by ACCESS traders because the number contained steep draws in the isolated West Coast region.
"It's a little more bearish than the actual draw (shows)," one broker said.

NYMEX heating oil traded at 56.75 cents a gallon, up 0.57 cents from the settle amid volume of 73 lots in April and 179 in all months. Gasoline was bought at 68 cents, up 0.52 cents as 309 lots changed hands in April, traders said.
